intro: Nordenstamia stellatopilosa, commonly known as the star-pilose nordenstamia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a soft, white or pale pink hue. The plant has small, hairy leaves that are arranged in an alternate pattern along the stem. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
